com.example.federico.wearableui.viewport

Class Viewport

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • com.example.federico.wearableui.viewport.Viewport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IViewport
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContinuousViewport

    public class Viewport
extends View
implements IViewport
    A Viewport is a custom View that has width and height equivalent or greater than the screen in which such View is displayed. This View is the only View that a ViewportActivity can use as its ContentView. It has the ability to be navigated (or to be scrolled) through its scroll() method, which takes as argument the orientation of the wearer's Gaze. From the framework's point of view, a Viewport is basically a 2D blackboard that can be scrolled by the movement of the user's head. It's also important to know that a Viewport has a redefined coordinate system from a user's perspective: the center of the Viewport is (0, 0), the top left corner is (-width / 2, height / 2), the top right is (width / 2, height / 2), the bottom left is (-width / 2, -height / 2), the bottom right is (width / 2, -height / 2), making it the exact same as a Cartesian plane.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Viewport.FieldOfView
      Wrapper class used to express the dimension and position of the portion of the viewport that is visible to the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Viewport

        public Viewport(Context context)
        Constructs a Viewport with the dimensions of the device screen.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context.

      • Viewport

        public Viewport(Context context,
                float extraSize)
        Constructs a Viewport with the passed extra dimensions.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context.
        extraSize - the percentage of extra width and extra height relative to the screen dimensions. For example a 0.5 indicates a Viewport that is 50% taller and wider than the device screen.

      • Viewport

        public Viewport(Context context,
                float extraWidth,
                float extraHeight)
        Constructs a Viewport with the passed extra dimensions.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context.
        extraWidth - the percentage of extra width relative to the screen dimensions. For example a 0.5 indicates a Viewport that is 50% wider than the device screen.
        extraHeight - the percentage of extra height relative to the screen dimensions. For example a 0.5 indicates a Viewport that is 50% taller than the device screen.

      • drawText

        public DrawableText drawText(Point where,
                             java.lang.String text,
                             int size,
                             int color,
                             int alpha,
                             boolean fill)
        Description copied from interface: IViewport
        Draws the passed text on the Viewport with the specified parameters.
        Specified by:
        drawText in interface IViewport
        Parameters:
        where - the bottom left Point where the text has to be drawn (relative to the Viewport coordinates).
        text - a String of text.
        size - the size of the text to be drawn.
        color - an int representing a color with whom the text will be drawn.
        alpha - an alpha value for the text (from 0 to 255).
        fill - true if the text should be drawn with a fill style, false if it should be drawn with a stroke style.
        Returns:
        a DrawableText object representing what was drawn.

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(View v,
                       MotionEvent event)

      • scrollAccordingly

        public void scrollAccordingly(float pitch,
                              float yaw)
        Description copied from interface: IViewport
        Scrolls the Viewport by modifying the value of its margins based upon the angles passed as argument. A call to this method also refreshes the Viewport by forcing it to redraw itself.
        Specified by:
        scrollAccordingly in interface IViewport
        Parameters:
        pitch - the pitch angle in degrees of the Gaze from its calibration orientation. This will determine of how many pixels the topMargin of the Viewport will change (in other words, this will determine the magnitude of the scrolling along the y axis).
        yaw - the yaw angle in degrees of the Gaze from its calibration orientation. This will determine of how many pixels the leftMargin of the Viewport will change (in other words, this will determine the magnitude of the scrolling along the x axis).

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Description copied from interface: IViewport
        Locks the Viewport so that it can no longer be scrolled.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface IViewport

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Description copied from interface: IViewport
        Unlocks the Viewport making it scrollable.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface IViewport
